summary: Round 1 code duplication fix (M2) was excellent - legacy function properly deleted. However, discovered NEW CRITICAL issue: dead code `_async_client` property references non-existent field and will cause AttributeError. Must delete lines 656-661 in theme_extractor.py before merge.

issues.title: Dead Code - `_async_client` Property References Non-Existent Field
issues.description: The async_client property getter references self._async_client but this field is never initialized in __init__. Will raise AttributeError on first access. This is dead code (implementation uses asyncio.to_thread instead) that should be deleted.
issues.recommendation: Delete lines 656-661 entirely. The async implementation uses asyncio.to_thread(self.extract, ...) and doesn't need a separate async client property.

issues.title: Minor Inconsistency in Lock Comment Placement
issues.description: Lock initialization has inline comment explaining WHY, but usage sites have no comments explaining what critical section protects. Minor consistency issue.
issues.recommendation: Add brief comments at lock usage sites for consistency: '# Thread-safe: snapshot session signatures under lock (Issue #148)'

M2_code_duplication.assessment: EXCELLENT - Legacy function completely deleted, eliminating divergence risk

threading_lock.assessment: Properly documented with Issue #148 reference at initialization and all usage sites

previous_issues_still_present: M3 (inner function scope) - acceptable, intentional closure
M4 (docstring historical context) - acceptable, useful context
